intro: Barlia robertiana lusus candida, commonly known as the white barlia, is a rare and striking flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbel-like inflorescence. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
